meanings.definition: To strike or hit heavily and repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter was pounding nails into the wood.
meanings.sent2: She was pounding the dough to make bread.
meanings.sent3: The drummer kept pounding the drums so loudly that the neighbors complained.
meanings.sent4: The rain was pounding on the roof like a thousand tiny hammers.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's fists were pounding against his opponent's body in the ring.

meanings.sent1: The pounding of the hammer echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The pounding of the waves against the shore could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The pounding of the bass at the concert made the floor vibrate.
meanings.sent4: The pounding of the judge's gavel signaled the end of the trial.
meanings.sent5: The pounding of the earthquake shook the entire town awake in fear.

meanings.definition: A throbbing or pulsating sensation, typically in the head.
meanings.sent1: She felt a pounding in her head after running for too long.
meanings.sent2: The pounding in his head made it hard to concentrate on his work.
meanings.sent3: The pounding in her head seemed to keep rhythm with the music playing.
meanings.sent4: The pounding in his head was like a drum solo at a rock concert.
meanings.sent5: The pounding in her head was so intense that she had to lie down and rest.
